Package game.graphics

Class GameLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.graphics.GameLoop
  • public class GameLoop
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game Loop runs constantly during a game. It continuously redraws the game entities to display their movements and actions.
    Author:
    Andreea

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static boolean isRunning
      Boolean value that tracks when the game loop is active

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameLoop()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void connected()
      Sets the connection flag to true
      static void disconnected()
      Sets the connection flag to false
      static void drawScoreboard​(ClientLogic client, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Draws the score board in the game window
      static void render​(ClientLogic client, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Draws all the entities on the screen as they move
      static void start​(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, ClientLogic client)
      Starts the game loop and renders the game constantly using an animation timer
      static void stop()
      Stops the game loop from running

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static void start​(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                         ClientLogic client)
        Starts the game loop and renders the game constantly using an animation timer
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context the rendering happens in
        client - The client that holds information about the game

      • stop

        public static void stop()
        Stops the game loop from running

        Draws the score board in the game window
        Parameters:

        gc - The graphics context the game window is drawn in

      • render

        Draws all the entities on the screen as they move
        Parameters:
        client - The client that holds the information
        gc - The graphics context that the game window is drawn in
